poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Assiduously fail in every thing you do; the holy drinker, Vin santo, cantuccini. Roses flail, Restrained on thorn collars from candles on this terrace Where I watch that grill till the coals collapse, Though one frail basket bears a spark, Its twindling bark, to the burning ghatts And pilgrims ferried, drop by drop, to a paradise That so recalls This place.
